intro: Trichostema laxum, commonly known as the slender bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Trichostema laxum is often found in California and parts of Nevada, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
